title: "What is the Symbolism Behind the Third Degree of Initiation in the Palazzo and How Does it Relate to Dante's Work?"
first_phrase: This text explores the symbolism and meanings behind the Palladium of the Order, representing the Truth and the third degree of initiation. The Principi di Mercede are the ones who achieve this stage through their triple virtue. The symbols of this degree include the tricolored veil covering the naked statue of Truth and the three hermetic colors: green, white, and red. The numerical symbolism of the degree is based on the number three and its powers and revolves around the number of nine. The ending 200 tokens discuss the significance of the number nine in various aspects, including the number of lights in the temple and the age ritual.
content: La parola émetb, verità, consta di tre lettere, la prima, la mediana, e l'ultima dell'alfabeto ebraico. Il suo valore numerico è 441, ossia nove. Sul trono stanno nove luci. Nel tempio stanno nove colonne, ciascheduna delle quali porta un candelabro a nove luci; ossia in tutto vi sono 81 luci. L'età di 81 anni è l'età rituale. Non staremo a ricordare quale importanza annetta Dante al tre ed al nove, e con quanta frequenza il numero nove ricorra nella « Vita NUOL'cl »: il Valli riporta (op. cit., p. 273) dei versa in cui Jacopo da Lentini propone che « le mercé siano strette... né dagli amadori chiamate infilzo che compie anni nove ».
last_phrase: In conclusion, it is fascinating to explore the symbolism and significance of numbers in various cultures, such as how the number nine is considered sacred in many traditions and epics. The age of 81 is believed to be a ritual age, and the number 441, which is the numerical value of the word "truth," further emphasizes the importance of this number. The use of numbers in literature, like in Dante's works, adds another layer of complexity to their symbolism.
